intro: Vicatia wolffiana, commonly known as the Wolffian vicatia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a slight fragrance. Its botanical structure includes stipules and a corolla with five lobes, typical of the Rubiaceae family. Vicatia wolffiana is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests or shrublands.
